titles.title: Small Business Innovation Impact Act
A bill to require the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration to submit a report on small business innovation.
Small Business Innovation Impact Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

bill.summary:
Small Business Innovation Impact Act
This bill requires the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration to submit an analysis, using existing resources, to specified congressional committees on:
the investment of small businesses in developing new and useful inventions and obtaining patents on them; the importance of university technology transfer to small businesses; the use of patent licensing arrangements by them; the impact of patent ownership for small businesses on attracting outside investment, creating new jobs, protecting against foreign infringing goods, and competing against larger businesses; and the impact on small businesses from patent-related demand letters and civil actions arising under federal law relating to patent infringement.
